registerForPathChange.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: path
params.description: The name of the event e.x. segment1/segment2

params.name: priority
params.description: The priority of the callback function

return.description: The object containing the different segments from the parsed URL

parseURL.description: Parses a url and returns an object containing the folowing data (if found): protocol, domain, post, path and path segments, hash and hash segments, query string and an object containing a key/value pair representation of the query
parseURL.author: Justin Windle

params.name: url
params.description: The url that we need to parse

getState.description: It returns the state of the object
getState.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

sortByPriority.description: Sorts an array based on the priority key
sortByPriority.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: steps
params.description: The number of steps that you want to go forward

params.name: steps
params.description: The number of steps that you want to go backwards

registerForEvent.description: Registers a specific callback to a specific event
registerForEvent.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: eventType
params.description: The name of the event e.x. push, pop

return.description: True if the history api is supported

supportsHistoryAPI.description: Checks if the history API is supported
supportsHistoryAPI.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

replace.description: Replaces the current state with a new state
replace.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: state
params.description: The state could be a JSON object that is passed on the popstate

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the page. Most browsers don't use it yet

params.name: url
params.description: The url that we need to push

return.description: Returns an object with the following keys

getAPIState.description: Gets the current state by reading the URL
getAPIState.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

sortRegisteredPathMembers.description: Sorts the array based on priority
sortRegisteredPathMembers.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

return.description: True if hash change event is supported

supportsHashChange.description: Checks if the onhashchange is supported
supportsHashChange.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: eventType
params.description: The name of the event e.x. push, pop

push.description: Pushes a new state on the history api
push.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: state
params.description: The state; could be a JSON object that is passed on the popstate

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the page. Most browsers don't use it yet

params.name: url
params.description: The url that we need to push

onPopstate.description: This is function is triggered on a window popstate
onPopstate.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

params.name: e
params.description: The object returned from the event

notifyRegisteredPathChangeMembers.description: Notifies all the registered members when a path change happens
notifyRegisteredPathChangeMembers.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

checkHashChange.description: Performs a check to see if the hash has changed and triggers then onPopstate function
checkHashChange.author: Thodoris Tsiridis

registeredMembers.description: It holds all the registered events for the pop and push

registeredPathMembers.description: It holds all the registered events for the path changes

hashChangeIntervalId.description: Holds the intervalId for the setInterval function if the History API isn't supported and hashes are used instead

hashListenInterval.description: After how many milliseconds the app will listen for a hash change

isHistoryAPISupported.description: It is true if the History API is supported

isRefresh.description: It is set to true the first time we get a popstate

seventytwolions.Router.description: Routing manager is responsible for listening to popstates in order to dispatch events. Clients can register their interest on these events
